title: Authors and Citation
text: Cidre González , Ariza Salamanca , González Moreno P, Ruiz Gómez F (2025). phytorisk: Package (Title Case). R package version 0.1.0, https://cidree.github.io/phytorisk/.
code: @Manual{,   title = {phytorisk: What the Package Does (Title Case)},   author = {Adrián {Cidre González} and Antonio {Ariza Salamanca} and Pablo {González Moreno} and Francisco José {Ruiz Gómez}},   year = {2025},   note = {R package version 0.1.0},   url = {https://cidree.github.io/phytorisk/}, }

title: What the Package Does (Title Case)
text: phytorisk R package developed quantify risk invasion oomycete Phytophthora cinnamomi Rands (Pc hereafter). Pc pathogen infects plant’s roots, many cases, kills host. dispersal pathogen depends multiple factors, depicted next figure: Potential mechanisms dispersal Pc Movement inoculum field due diffusive root--root contact mec_rootcontact() Inoculum movement roots water particles within soil mec_soilwater() Dispersion inoculum domestic wild animal movement mec_zoospread() Inoculum spread surface water mec_surfaceflow()

title: What the Package Does (Title Case)
text: can install last stable version phytorisk GitHub :

title: Root-to-root contact — mec_rootcontact
text: Simulates diffusive inoculum spread root contact

title: Root-to-root contact — mec_rootcontact
text: treecover single-band SpatRaster 1 represents host trees, 0 represents background area aoi sf polygon representing area interest. Used mask tree cover poi single-point sf object denoting point interest run simulations quiet TRUE, suppress message progress bar

title: Root-to-root contact — mec_rootcontact
text: SpatRaster

title: Root-to-root contact — mec_rootcontact
text: function models inoculum movement due root--root contact based tree continuity. calculates vegetation continuity counting connected pixels within 3×3 window. continuity exists, new raster created connected pixels marked 1. function identifies pixels connected foci within study area. direct pixel--pixel contact trees exists, infection risk considered zero.

title: Root-to-root contact — mec_rootcontact
text: Cardillo, E., Abad, E., Meyer, S., 2021. Iberian oak decline caused Phytophthora cinnamomi: spatiotemporal analysis incorporating effect host heterogeneities landscape scale. . Pathol. 51, e12667. doi:10.1111/efp.12667 Cardillo, E., Acedo, ., Abad, E., 2018. Topographic effects dispersal patterns Phytophthora cinnamomi stand scale Spanish heathland. PloS One 13, e0195060.

title: Root-to-root contact — mec_rootcontact
code: # \donttest{ ## load packages library(sf) #> Linking to GEOS 3.12.1, GDAL 3.8.4, PROJ 9.4.0; sf_use_s2() is TRUE library(terra) #> terra 1.8.50  ## load data study_area_sf <- st_read(system.file("spatial/tejera.geojson", package = "phytorisk")) #> Reading layer `tejera' from data source  #>   `/home/runner/work/_temp/Library/phytorisk/spatial/tejera.geojson'  #>   using driver `GeoJSON' #> Simple feature collection with 1 feature and 1 field #> Geometry type: POLYGON #> Dimension:     XY #> Bounding box:  xmin: 332469.4 ymin: 4206413 xmax: 333200.5 ymax: 4207244 #> Projected CRS: ETRS89 / UTM zone 30N poi_sf <- st_read(system.file("spatial/poi.geojson", package = "phytorisk")) #> Reading layer `poi' from data source  #>   `/home/runner/work/_temp/Library/phytorisk/spatial/poi.geojson'  #>   using driver `GeoJSON' #> Simple feature collection with 1 feature and 0 fields #> Geometry type: POINT #> Dimension:     XY #> Bounding box:  xmin: 332973.8 ymin: 4206649 xmax: 332973.8 ymax: 4206649 #> Projected CRS: ETRS89 / UTM zone 30N trees_sr <- rast(system.file("spatial/trees_light.tiff", package = "phytorisk"))  ## simulate mechanism mec_rootcontact_sr <- mec_rootcontact(trees_sr, study_area_sf, poi_sf) #> ℹ Preparing tree data... #> ✔ Tree data prepared [53ms] #>  #> ℹ Finding root-to-root contact... #> ✔ Finished [12.8s] #>  # }

title: Water inoculum movement — mec_soilwater
text: Simulates inoculum transport via water soil matrix

title: Water inoculum movement — mec_soilwater
text: dem single-band SpatRaster digital elevation model poi single-point sf object denoting point interest run simulations th threshold flow accumulation delineate streams quiet TRUE, suppress message progress bar

title: Water inoculum movement — mec_soilwater
text: SpatRaster

title: Water inoculum movement — mec_soilwater
text: function models inoculum movement soil, considering flow direction altitude wet intermediate moisture conditions. identifies pixels flow direction matches adjacent foci, processes connected pixels based altitude differences. result binary raster showing spatial pattern inoculum dispersal, constrained topography moisture.

title: Water inoculum movement — mec_soilwater
text: Ristaino, J., Gumpertz, M., 2000. New Frontiers Study Dispersal Spatial Analysis Epidemics Caused Species Genus Phytophthora. Annu. Rev. Phytopathol. 38, 541–576. doi:10.1146/annurev.phyto.38.1.541 Vannini, ., Natili, G., Anselmi, N., Montaghi, ., Vettraino, .M., 2010. Distribution gradient analysis Ink disease chestnut forests. . Pathol. 40, 73–86. doi:10.1111/j.1439-0329.2009.00609.x Vannini, ., Natili, G., Thomidis, T., Belli, C., Morales-Rodriguez, C., 2021. Anthropogenic landscape features associated ink disease impact Central Italy. . Pathol. 51, e12722. doi:10.1111/efp.12722

title: Water inoculum movement — mec_soilwater
code: ## load packages library(sf) library(terra)  ## load data dem_sr <- rast(system.file("spatial/dem_light.tiff", package = "phytorisk")) poi_sf <- st_read(system.file("spatial/poi.geojson", package = "phytorisk")) #> Reading layer `poi' from data source  #>   `/home/runner/work/_temp/Library/phytorisk/spatial/poi.geojson'  #>   using driver `GeoJSON' #> Simple feature collection with 1 feature and 0 fields #> Geometry type: POINT #> Dimension:     XY #> Bounding box:  xmin: 332973.8 ymin: 4206649 xmax: 332973.8 ymax: 4206649 #> Projected CRS: ETRS89 / UTM zone 30N  ## simulate mechanism mec_soilwater_sr <- mec_soilwater(dem_sr, poi_sf) #> Loading required namespace: flowdem #> ℹ Filling DEM... #> ✔ DEM filled [63ms] #>  #> ℹ Filling basins... #> ✔ Basins filled [35ms] #>  #> ℹ Removing depressions... #> ✔ Depressions removed [29ms] #>  #> ℹ Filling depressions... #> ✔ Depressions filled [29ms] #>  #> ℹ Getting flow directions... #> ✔ Flow directions [29ms] #>  #> ℹ Calculating flow accumulation... #> ✔ Flow accumulation calculated [28ms] #>  #> ℹ Delineating streams... #> ✔ Streams delineated [32ms] #>  #> ℹ Determining the wet front #> ✔ Wet front determined [914ms] #>

title: Inoculum spread — mec_surfacewater
text: Simulates spread inoculum surface water flow

title: Inoculum spread — mec_surfacewater
code: mec_surfacewater(dem, mec_soilwater, poi, buffer = 50, quiet = FALSE)

title: Inoculum spread — mec_surfacewater
text: dem single-band SpatRaster digital elevation model mec_soilwater result mec_soilwater poi single-point sf object denoting point interest run simulations buffer buffer meters extend spread every direction quiet TRUE, suppress message progress bar

title: Inoculum spread — mec_surfacewater
text: list surface flow risk (SpatRaster), surface water (sf)

title: Inoculum spread — mec_surfacewater
text: function models inoculum movement downslope streams using natural drainage network wetlands. creates binary raster closest stream foci selects associated downslope streams. topographic water index (TWI) used proxy soil moisture identify wetlands, creating binary raster pixels 90th percentile TWI. wetland raster combined stream raster define potential areas inoculum spread.

title: Inoculum spread — mec_surfacewater
text: Li, .Y., Williams, N., Fenwick, S.G., Hardy, G.E.St.J., Adams, P.J., 2014b. Potential dissemination Phytophthora cinnamomi feral pigs via ingestion infected plant material. Biol. Invasions 16, 765–774. doi:10.1007/s10530-013-0535-7 Ruiz-Gómez, F.J., Pérez-de-Luque, ., Navarro-Cerrillo, R.M., 2019. involvement Phytophthora root rot drought stress holm oak decline: ecophysiology microbiome influence. Curr. . Rep. 5, 251–266.

title: Inoculum spread — mec_surfacewater
code: ## load packages library(sf) library(terra)  ## load data poi_sf <- st_read(system.file("spatial/poi.geojson", package = "phytorisk")) #> Reading layer `poi' from data source  #>   `/home/runner/work/_temp/Library/phytorisk/spatial/poi.geojson'  #>   using driver `GeoJSON' #> Simple feature collection with 1 feature and 0 fields #> Geometry type: POINT #> Dimension:     XY #> Bounding box:  xmin: 332973.8 ymin: 4206649 xmax: 332973.8 ymax: 4206649 #> Projected CRS: ETRS89 / UTM zone 30N dem_sr <- rast(system.file("spatial/dem_light.tiff", package = "phytorisk")) trees_sr <- rast(system.file("spatial/trees_light.tiff", package = "phytorisk"))  ## simulate mechanism mec_soilwater_sr <- mec_soilwater(dem_sr, poi_sf) #> ℹ Filling DEM... #> ✔ DEM filled [27ms] #>  #> ℹ Filling basins... #> ✔ Basins filled [31ms] #>  #> ℹ Removing depressions... #> ✔ Depressions removed [19ms] #>  #> ℹ Filling depressions... #> ✔ Depressions filled [19ms] #>  #> ℹ Getting flow directions... #> ✔ Flow directions [19ms] #>  #> ℹ Calculating flow accumulation... #> ✔ Flow accumulation calculated [38ms] #>  #> ℹ Delineating streams... #> ✔ Streams delineated [33ms] #>  #> ℹ Determining the wet front #> ✔ Wet front determined [882ms] #>  mec_surface_sr <- mec_surfacewater(dem_sr, mec_soilwater_sr, poi_sf) #> ℹ Calculating natural drainage network... #> ✔ Natural drainage network calculated [71ms] #>  #> ℹ Identifying surface water close to foci... #> ✔ Surface water close to foci identified [72ms] #>  #> ℹ Finding connected pixels... #> ✔ Finished [873ms] #>

title: Dispersion by animals — mec_zoospread
text: Optional Module. Simulates dispersion domestic wild animal movement

title: Dispersion by animals — mec_zoospread
code: mec_zoospread(   aoi,   poi,   mec_surface,   n_animals = 5,   n_steps = 100,   pixel_size = 1,   n_iter = 10,   dist = 5,   quiet = FALSE )

title: Dispersion by animals — mec_zoospread
text: SpatRaster

title: Dispersion by animals — mec_zoospread
text: function models animal movement series straight-line steps towards resource sources, avoiding exclusion areas staying within defined boundaries. randomly assigns initial animal positions calculates movement direction towards resources. direction normalized randomized using rotation matrix. Animal trajectories stored vector format, crossing foci identified analysis. Simulation parameters, number animals steps, set start.

title: Dispersion by animals — mec_zoospread
text: Kliejunas, J.T., Ko, W.H., 1976. Dispersal Phytophthora cinnamomi island Hawaii. Phytopathology 66, 457–460. Li, .Y., Williams, N., Fenwick, S.G., Hardy, G.E.St.J., Adams, P.J., 2014b. Potential dissemination Phytophthora cinnamomi feral pigs via ingestion infected plant material. Biol. Invasions 16, 765–774. doi:10.1007/s10530-013-0535-7 Cardillo, E., Acedo, ., Abad, E., 2018. Topographic effects dispersal patterns Phytophthora cinnamomi stand scale Spanish heathland. PloS One 13, e0195060.

title: Phytophthora ensemble risk — phytorisk_ensemble
text: Calculates Phytophthora cinnamomi's ensemble risk mechanisms

title: Phytophthora ensemble risk — phytorisk_ensemble
code: phytorisk_ensemble(   mec_soilwater,   mec_rootcontact,   mec_surfacewater,   mec_zoospread = NULL,   weights = "equal" )

title: Phytophthora ensemble risk — phytorisk_ensemble
text: mec_soilwater result mec_soilwater mec_rootcontact result mec_rootcontact mec_surfacewater result mec_surfacewater mec_zoospread optional module. result mec_zoospread weights weights ensemble model. default uses weights model. argument accepts numeric vector corresponding weights. See Details

title: Phytophthora ensemble risk — phytorisk_ensemble
text: SpatRaster

title: Phytophthora ensemble risk — phytorisk_ensemble
text: function calculates ensemble risk weighted sum individual risk models follows: \(Risk = w_1 \cdot Mec_{soilwater} + w_2 \cdot Mec_{rootcontact} + w_3 \cdot Mec_{mec_surfacewater} + w_4  \cdot Mec_{zoospread}\). \(w_i = 0.25\) mec_zoospread null, \(w_i = \frac{1}{3}\) mec_zoospread null. Additionally, user can specify numeric vector length 3 4 specifying desired weights based expert criteria.

title: Raw Phytophthora ensemble risk — phytorisk_ensemble_raw
text: Calculates Phytophthora cinnamomi's ensemble risk raw data

title: Raw Phytophthora ensemble risk — phytorisk_ensemble_raw
text: aoi sf polygon representing area interest. Used mask tree cover poi single-point sf object denoting point interest run simulations dem single-band SpatRaster digital elevation model treecover single-band SpatRaster 1 represents host trees, 0 represents background area weights weights ensemble model. default uses weights model. argument accepts numeric vector corresponding weights. See phytorisk_ensemble th threshold flow accumulation delineate streams buffer buffer meters extend spread every direction include_zoospread logical. Whether include optional module mec_zoospread ... arguments passed mec_zoospread quiet TRUE, suppress message progress bar
